meanings.definition: Organized or arranged according to a method.
meanings.sent1: The methodised schedule helped us stay on track with our tasks.
meanings.sent2: Her methodised approach to cleaning made the whole process much easier.
meanings.sent3: The methodised way she color-coded her wardrobe was both efficient and visually pleasing.
meanings.sent4: His methodised thinking was like a well-oiled machine, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent5: The methodised layout of the store made it simple to find what we needed.

meanings.sent1: The methodised study plan improved his grades significantly.
meanings.sent2: The methodised filing system made it easy to locate important documents.
meanings.sent3: She methodised her morning routine to ensure she never forgot anything.
meanings.sent4: The methodised way he approached problem-solving was like following a clear map.
meanings.sent5: The methodised structure of the presentation kept the audience engaged throughout.
